meanings.definition: The action of prohibiting or forbidding something.
meanings.sent1: The interdiction of sugary snacks in school helps promote healthier eating habits.
meanings.sent2: The interdiction of smoking in public places has led to cleaner air for everyone.
meanings.sent3: The interdiction of using phones during class made the students come up with creative ways to communicate.
meanings.sent4: Her interdiction of any negative talk created a positive atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The interdiction of littering in the park keeps the environment clean and beautiful.

meanings.definition: The act of intercepting and preventing the movement of goods or people.
meanings.sent1: The coast guard's interdiction of illegal fishing boats protected the marine life.
meanings.sent2: The police conducted an interdiction operation to stop the smuggling of contraband.
meanings.sent3: The interdiction of the thief by the security guard was swift and effective.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp eyes acted as an interdiction, spotting any suspicious activity.
meanings.sent5: The interdiction of the criminal at the border prevented a major security breach.

meanings.definition: A legal process that allows for the seizure of property.
meanings.sent1: The interdiction of the suspect's assets was part of the investigation.
meanings.sent2: The court issued an interdiction on the property until the case was resolved.
meanings.sent3: The interdiction of the stolen goods by the police surprised the thieves.
meanings.sent4: The interdiction of the valuable artifacts was a blow to the art thieves.
meanings.sent5: The interdiction of the illegal merchandise was a significant win for law enforcement.
